content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's fun and interesting and appropriate for an easy classic puzzle.

A nice easy puzzle.

The formatting of the time into HH:MM:SS feels like a random addition to the basic puzzle problem and might be unnecessary.

You mention briefly in the initial problem summary to round down seconds when printing the result. I think perhaps that should be restated in the detailed "Output" description.  In my initial solution, I assumed that seconds should be rounded up to a whole number of seconds (using ceil()), since that this the number of whole seconds someone would have to wait to be sure the bathtub was full. But from your example cases (and the initial problem summary), it is clear that you expect seconds to be rounded down.

It would also be a good idea to clarify that there may be multiple leaks at the same height, since at least one of your test cases depends on that assumption.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Classic problem, it has its place here

Goal section
* Please change "each leaks" to "each leak".

* Please change "don't let" to "does not leak".

* Please change "leak height" to [[leakHeight]].

* Please change "surface" to "surface area".

* Please change [[H]] to [[h]] for consistency.

* Please mention any rounding requirements.

Input section
* Please change "surface" to "surface area".

* Suggest to change "mn" to "minute" (2 times).

Output section
* Please change the formatting from <<bold>> to {{constant}}, and remove the quotation marks.

Thanks.
Thanks you, I applied the corrections.
